item.title: Docs: ProxyProfile v1alpha1 API Reference
item.description:
Packages:

  • flomesh.io/v1alpha1

flomesh.io/v1alpha1

Package v1alpha1 is the v1alpha1 version of the API.

Resource Types:
  • ProxyProfile

ProxyProfile

ProxyProfile is the Schema for the proxyprofiles API

Field Description
apiVersion
string		 flomesh.io/v1alpha1
kind
string 		ProxyProfile
metadata
Kubernetes meta/v1.ObjectMeta 		Refer to the Kubernetes API documentation for the fields of the metadata field.
spec
ProxyProfileSpec

disabled
bool

If this ProxyProfile is Disabled. A disabled ProxyProfile doesn’t participate the sidecar injection process.
mode
ProxyConfigMode

ConfigMode tells where the sidecar loads the scripts/config from, Local means from local files mounted by configmap, Remote means loads from remote pipy repo. Default value is Remote
selector
Kubernetes meta/v1.LabelSelector

Selector is a label query over pods that should be injected This’s optional, please NOTE a nil or empty Selector match nothing not everything.
namespace
string

Namespace ProxyProfile will only match the pods in the namespace otherwise, match pods in all namespaces(in cluster)
config
map[string]string

Config contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, ‘-’, ‘_’ or ‘.’. Values with non-UTF-8 byte sequences must use the BinaryData field. This option is mutually exclusive with RepoBaseUrl option, you can only have either one.
serviceEnv
[]Kubernetes core/v1.EnvVar

List of environment variables to set in each of the service containers. Cannot be updated.
restartPolicy
ProxyRestartPolicy

RestartPolicy indicates if ProxyProfile is updated, those already injected PODs should be updated or not. Default value is Never, it only has impact to new created PODs, existing PODs will not be updated.
restartScope
ProxyRestartScope

RestartScope takes effect when RestartPolicy is Always, it tells if we can restart the entire POD to apply the changes or only the sidecar containers inside the POD. Default value is Owner.
sidecars
[]Sidecar

List of sidecars, will be injected into POD. It must have at least ONE sidecar and up to 5 maximum.
status
ProxyProfileStatus

ProxyConfigMode (string alias)

(Appears on:ProxyProfileSpec)

Value Description

"Local"

"Remote"

ProxyProfileSpec

(Appears on:ProxyProfile)

ProxyProfileSpec defines the desired state of ProxyProfile

Field Description
disabled
bool

If this ProxyProfile is Disabled. A disabled ProxyProfile doesn’t participate the sidecar injection process.
mode
ProxyConfigMode

ConfigMode tells where the sidecar loads the scripts/config from, Local means from local files mounted by configmap, Remote means loads from remote pipy repo. Default value is Remote
selector
Kubernetes meta/v1.LabelSelector

Selector is a label query over pods that should be injected This’s optional, please NOTE a nil or empty Selector match nothing not everything.
namespace
string

Namespace ProxyProfile will only match the pods in the namespace otherwise, match pods in all namespaces(in cluster)
config
map[string]string

Config contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, ‘-’, ‘_’ or ‘.’. Values with non-UTF-8 byte sequences must use the BinaryData field. This option is mutually exclusive with RepoBaseUrl option, you can only have either one.
serviceEnv
[]Kubernetes core/v1.EnvVar

List of environment variables to set in each of the service containers. Cannot be updated.
restartPolicy
ProxyRestartPolicy

RestartPolicy indicates if ProxyProfile is updated, those already injected PODs should be updated or not. Default value is Never, it only has impact to new created PODs, existing PODs will not be updated.
restartScope
ProxyRestartScope

RestartScope takes effect when RestartPolicy is Always, it tells if we can restart the entire POD to apply the changes or only the sidecar containers inside the POD. Default value is Owner.
sidecars
[]Sidecar

List of sidecars, will be injected into POD. It must have at least ONE sidecar and up to 5 maximum.

ProxyProfileStatus

(Appears on:ProxyProfile)

ProxyProfileStatus defines the observed state of ProxyProfile

Field Description
configMaps
map[string]string

All associated config maps, key is namespace and value is the name of configmap

ProxyRestartPolicy (string alias)

(Appears on:ProxyProfileSpec)

Value Description

"Always"

"Never"

ProxyRestartScope (string alias)

(Appears on:ProxyProfileSpec)

Value Description

"Owner"

ProxyRestartScopePod ProxyRestartScope = “Pod” ProxyRestartScopeSidecar ProxyRestartScope = “Sidecar”

Sidecar

(Appears on:ProxyProfileSpec)

Field Description
name
string

Name of the container specified as a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name (DNS_LABEL). Cannot be updated.
startupScriptName
string

The file name of entrypoint script for starting the PIPY instance. If not provided, the default value is the value of Name field with surfix .js. For example, if the Name of the sidecar is proxy, it looks up proxy.js in config folder. It only works in local config mode, if pulls scripts from remote repo, the repo server returns the name of startup script.
image
string

Docker image name. This field is optional to allow higher level config management to default or override container images in workload controllers like Deployments and StatefulSets.
imagePullPolicy
Kubernetes core/v1.PullPolicy

Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated.
env
[]Kubernetes core/v1.EnvVar

List of environment variables to set in the sidecar container. Cannot be updated.
command
[]string

Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image’s ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container’s environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated.
args
[]string

Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image’s CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container’s environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated.
resources
Kubernetes core/v1.ResourceRequirements

Compute Resources required by this container. Cannot be updated.

Generated with gen-crd-api-reference-docs on git commit 6e7a62e.
